newsitem.title: NORWAY: Storebrand share falls on merger snub.
newsitem.headline: Storebrand share falls on merger snub.

text.p: Shares in Norwegian insurance company Storebrand ASA were trading down early on Friday after shareholders blocked a proposed merger with Christiania Bank og Kreditkasse ASA a day earlier.
Storebrand dropped to a low of 43 crowns, down almost nine percent, shortly after the opening of the Oslo bourse, but slowly regained lost ground to stand 3.4 percent off at 45.50 crowns by 0848 GMT.
At the same time Christiania BaNk's stock stood unchanged at 24.50 crowns.
Storebrand's board failed by a slim margin to win a two-thirds approval for the merger when shareholders voted at an extraordinary general meeting late on Thursday.
Earlier Christiania shareholders had given a green light to the proposal.
